passage_text: The total list price for in-state Ohio residents to go to BGSU-Firelands is $14,416 for the 2014/2015 academic year. Out-of-state students who don't possess Ohio residence can expect a one year cost of $21,724. Students residing at home with parents providing food and housing can expect a total cost of $5,996. If attending from out-of-state, the tuition is $12,014 which represents a 155% premium. The school charges an additional fees of $240 in addition to tuition bringing the total effective in-state tuition to $4,946.

GENERAL INFORMATION Tuition: BGSU Firelands - $196.10 per credit hour; FRMCSN - $258 per credit hour. General Fees: BGSU Firelands -$9.35 per credit hour, FRMCSN - $15 per credit hour (Fall & Spring) up to a maximum of $180 per semester. (all general fees are included in course fees) . BGSU Registration Fee: $8 for each semester student is enrolled in a BGSU Firelands general education course. BGSU Lab Fee : $20 for the Microbiology course (BIOL 3140/3150) and A & P course (BIOL 3320). Lab fee is included in tuition charge for course

Bowling Green State University Firelands tuition is $4,706 per year for in-state residents. This is 44% more expensive than the national average public two year tuition of $3,263. The cost is $5,746 and 55% cheaper than the average Ohio tuition of $10,452 for 2 year colleges. Tuition ranks 23rd in Ohio amongst 2 year colleges for affordability and is the 66th most expensive 2 year college in the state. If attending from out-of-state, the tuition is $12,014 which represents a 155% premium. The school charges an additional fees of $240 in addition to tuition bringing the total effective in-state tuition to $4,946.

3,532.08. Full-time UC Bond Fee. The fee of $12.50/credit hour is earmarked for repayment of the bond debt incurred for the addition/rehabilitation of the University Center beginning fall term 2009. The maximum for a full time student is $150 per term/$300 per academic year (fee applies to fall and spring terms only). 150.00.

Annual Total Cost. The total list price for in-state Ohio residents to go to BGSU is $20,020 for the 2014/2015 academic year. Out-of-state students who don't possess Ohio residence can expect a one year cost of $27,328. This is 41% more expensive than the national average public four year tuition of $6,429. The cost is $8,751 and 49% cheaper than the average Ohio tuition of $17,847 for 4 year colleges. Tuition ranks 31st in Ohio amongst 4 year colleges for affordability and is the 84th most expensive 4 year college in the state. If attending from out-of-state, the tuition is $16,404 which represents a 80% premium

Cost effective. Not only can students save money by avoiding the costs of campus housing at a larger residential college, but tuition at BGSU Firelands is half of the cost of most four-year institutions in Ohio. Full-time tuition at BGSU Firelands is only $2,465.40 per semester. Personalized attention.
